alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A complex of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Wilson, Neosho and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1150 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a complex of strong thunderstorms over southern Wilson and western Neosho counties, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Neodesha, Erie, St. Paul, Thayer, Altoona, Galesburg, Stark, Earlton, Lake Parsons and Chanute Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
